Pictures: Scenes from the campaign trail

Senator Scott Brown and his family lined up to vote in Wrentham. Brian Ballou/ Boston Globe
There was a long line at a polling station in Medway in the minutes before the polls opened at 7 a.m. Matt Pepin / Boston.com
Mitt Romney hugged Ann Romney after she introduced him at a New Hampshire campaign rally at Verizon Wireless Arena in Manchester, New Hampshire, last night. AP Photo/ Charles Dharapak
Rocker Bruce Springsteen welcomed President Obama to the stage during a rally on the last day of campaigning in the general election yesterday in Madison, Wisconsin. Chip Somodevilla/ Getty Images
Sen. Scott Brown was introduced at his election eve party at Lake Pearl Luciano's Restaurant last night. Matthew J. Lee/ Globe Staff
The "Truman Rally" on the night before Election Day took place on Centre Street in West Roxbury. Democratic senate candidate Elizabeth Warren was the final speaker of the event. Jim Davis/Globe Staff
In this still frame made from video, voters dropped their ballots in the ballot box after casting their votes early this morning in Dixville Notch, New Hampshire. AP Photo/APTN

Weather Wisdom Blog

Nor'easter on the way; snow possible in some spots

This next storm will be big, but not as large as the last one. The exact track of the storm is going to determine how much wind, rain and yes even snow will fall. (Globe, 6:15 a.m.)

Officials quiet on Bulger's hospitalization

Federal officials on Monday would not provide the location of James "Whitey" Bulger (pictured), who was rushed to a Boston hospital Sunday after complaining of chest pains, according to fire officials in Plymouth. (Globe)

Oct. tax collections off $48m in Mass.

Massachusetts tax collections in October were $48 million below those in the same month a year ago, and missed official benchmarks for the fourth consecutive month in this fiscal year. (Globe)
